You could extract that message into its own variable with a meaningful name to enhance readability and promote code reuse
A variable is a container for a value, which can be of various types. You can think of variables as a way to store information in your program.
To create a variable, you just assign it a value and then start using it. Assignment is done with a single equals sign (=):
message = "Please wait while the program is loading…"
Now you can use the variable message anywhere in the program, and its value will be equal to the string "Please wait while the program is loading…"
You can also change the value of a variable later on:\nprint(message)
